Reviews.Title: “Location location Location!!”
Reviews.Author: PD014
Reviews.Content: If you travel to Dubai for a vacation on a buget, this is a good place to be. this property is well located near airport, mall and metro station. Clean, good size rooms. breakfast buffet was really good. I would suggest they should change menu more often..some more options other than bread. They should improve on their room service, always took more than 2 calls to get refills for coffee and sugar packs in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Qonrad G
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, staff were very friendly. Short walk to the underground and is immediately across from Diera City Shopping Centre

Reviews.Title: “We had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: recycling
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Deira is a nice hotel with a good location. The entrance hall has a great design and our room was nicely equipped and spacious. The breakfast was very good and offered lots of choices and the swimming pool area is great for chilling out. The subway is just around the corner and brings you to all sights of Dubai and also the airport can be reached in a few minutes. The Deira City Mall is just opposite and offers great shopping and some restaurants. If you want to get to the beaches, you can make use of the free beach shuttle provided by the hotel. It is really convenient. The only negative point to mention would be the bathroom: We had cold water for the first 2 days of our stay. We complained at the reception 3 times until they send someone to check it. We were then told that because our room was located on the 8th floor, we had to wait for about 10 minutes until the shower was hot! What a waste of water in the middle of the desert!

Reviews.Title: “reasonably priced decent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: nottsinternational
Reviews.Content: Good sized clean rooms and a very quiet hotel. It’s about a 10-minute drive from the airport and opposite the Deira City shopping mall so quite a convenient location. I thought this was a reasonably priced decent business hotel and I’d stay here again. I’d probably have breakfast in the shopping centre next time (approx. AED 20 rather than AED 75 in the hotel). Although it has a very nice pool area it doesn’t get sun (in March) until about midday.

Reviews.Title: “This is a difficult one”
Reviews.Author: PaulCzCzechRepublic
Reviews.Content: You know, I always make a point of reading other peoples reviews before booking at hotel. With this hotel the reviews were mixed, so out of curiosity, I went for it..... The hotel is beautiful, clean, plush, well presented, excellent rooms, perfect location (shopping centre and metro oppisite) Breakfast was very good, the staff were friendl, nice clean pool outside. I would like to say I cant fault the place....and i dont want to... but I have to. When I read people complaining about the noise from the mosque. I thought to myself; some people are just not satisfied, they are in an Islam country, so get used to it people. Alas, when I got there I saw sorry heard where they were coming from. I have travelled many Islam countries in my life, but never have I heard The "call to prayer" so loud as from the Mosque next door to the hotel. I mean loud.. really really loud, and it starts at 0530 and happpens 5 times a day. So, its your call. Dont say I didnt warn you. All that said, would I use this hotel again? Yes, most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Deira City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Pam338
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not to bad, The first one better than the second. The first stay we were put on the side of the hotel that had a view (fourth floor) but with a mosque below us. The second stay we were on the same side of the building but on the second floor with a view out on to a solid wall. The carpet was also very stained. We were woken every morning at 5.30am with the Mosque chanting a prayer which seemed to go on for some time. The plus side for this hotel is that it is accross the road from the Deira City Mall (our room overlooked this mall as well as the Mosque)where you could get the Hop-On-Hop-Off bus for sightseeing and cheap evening meals. The breakfast in the hotel was really good with very friendly helpful staff. I would stay here again but would make sure of a room on the other side. Overall we loved Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: AK7811
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with a great location accross from the city centre. Has a lovely pool and a great breakfast rom with huge selection of cold cuts, eggs, breads fruits and pastries. Small bar which is good and has wifi, rooms are good, try to get the ones with a view facing the creek and away from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “very good recommendable hotel. business and pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: crazyshopper45
Reviews.Content: we have only come back from a 10 day visit to dubai. we stayed at novotel deira city centre, after family freinds recommended it. i must say its a very nice, clean and crisp modern hotel. we travelled as a family of 2 adults and 2 children under 10 years. the reception and lobby is huge and contemporary, very clean. the receptionist was very formal, would have liked him relax a little but then there are many business socilaites here so i could understand the professionalism that was given at the reception. we arrived 2am and signed a couple of papers and sent straight to our room. the room was clean, modern and undamamged furniture. the bathroom was clean and modern, with a seprate shower cubicle as well as a bathtub and shower in there too so great for soaking the kids! the room was comfortable we had a tea/coffee facility and a plasma tv, we had a sofa bed which pulled out to to a bed for the little one. the linen was clean and fresh you could tell. room service was good, every morning house keeping would greet us in the corridor, and he would clean and replenish tea/coffee/water and toiletries in the bathroom. i like the idea that the hotel has small messages around the room and bathroom on housekeeping, such as used towels to go ont he bathtub should they need replacing, or a note to leave on the bed if you need the sheets changing etc etc. there is a small washing line in the bathroom so great for drying swimwear out. there isnt a balcony this would have been nice as i felt cooped up at times in the room, but not important. the beds were comfortable. plenty of hot water in shower. there are 3 lifts which work super fast. the breakfast was the best part of our stay. firstly i would like to thank Daya and his excellent team for making our stay and breakfast enjoyable, they offered professional and fast service. the chef Nazar was absolutely BRILLIANT too. he would make any sort of egg dish for you, i always liked the way he presented poached eggs on toast with parsley and would personally come and give it to us on our table. he would be there ready to make amazing omlettes with different fillings, scrabbled or fried eggs. and his timing is perfect.well done. the buffet breakfast was an enormous range of toast, breads, coissants, jams, honey and cakes, biscuits etc etc, there was loads of choice on just this one table. the buffet hot bar always offered sausages, beans, hash browns, grilled huge tomatoes, pancakes, beef slices, and they would change the dishes every few days from mushrooms to other things. there was always hot yummy porridge and an arabian dish foules medames. there was a seperate table with fresh chilled juices, pineapple, orange and apple. also a range of kelloggs cereals and also 3 maybe 4 different types of milk, both hot or cold and chilled water. there was another bar which offered yogurts, cheeses, olives, cucumbers and fresh whole fruit. and there was also a fresh fruit bar, where different choices of chopped fresh melons, pineapple and mixed fruit salad was available. very nice and refreshing. the staff were always asking you if you needed tea/coffee refills or anything else. we were very happy with the staff in Tala restuarant, we only wish we had the time to dine here in the evening as it looked and smelt just as good as breakfast. the food was safe, plentiful and hot food and cold food available for breakfast. i never had to ask for anything to be refilled or had to que for anything. there are alot of business personels here during the early hours of breakfast whereas later there were couples and few families who were staying there. they cater for all and the layout of the room in spacious and comfortable. would have been nice to have a tv with news on, but there was always a choice of soft music on. there is free wifi in the lobby, although we never used it, as i didnt take my phone incase i loose it. i wasnt aware there was a pool, till i noticed afew days later whilst figuring out the lift/floors. the pool is wonderful and there is a seperate one for the children, however i was a little disspointed that the pool heater wasnt working for the remaining 3/4 days which we were there. i would have expected it to be fixed by then, the water was very cold, but the kids still went in for a dip. the pool area is amazingly relaxing and there is a lifeguard and staff for service/drinks and a bar. please bare in mind you have to be covered up to be at the bar, so just sling on a kaftan/shirt/sarong if your in a bikini/shorts. the changing facilities were good on this floor and toilets and showers/lockers were good and there is a nice small but state of art good clean gym. the first few days i heard lots of aircraft flying around, but it wasnt that bad. i actually also enjoyed the prayers of the early hours from the mosque across the road, it wasnt so loud or shockingly startling, but very calm soft voice. i didnt feel that this was a major issue.i did manage to sleep well through this. i did however hear a fair bit of music, and to say we were on the 9th top floor of the building. i wasnt sure where it was coming from but it seemed from below the side alley and i know they had a bar downstairs, but again it wasnt so bad, just that it went on till midnight. i did call reception one evening as i was having issue with the air con, but the recpetionist said its working and didnt really bother to send anyone up to check or help out, which was a little dissapointing. we slept in the room where it did get stuffy without the air con working, on the last day we managed to figure out how to use the thermostat for the air con, which was a little late and annoying! the hotel is situated bang opposite a huge shopping mall. this was very helpful as it had lots of british branding stores as well as uae's own top branded stores. just cross the main road and walk through the car park to get in. there are around 4/5 different currency exchange koisks inside, do shop around as they vary. and theres also a Boots chemist situated on the ground floor for any emergency bits you might need. there is a huge supermarket upstairs called carrefour, if you have kids or want to see a supermarket with difference its worth going to see the huge range and especially the fish bar! there are fast food chains in here if you want to grab something to eat, we only ate here on our fist day as we're not into fast food. but choice of chinese, arabian, mexican, indian, american and fillipino food. the hotel is easily accesable to the metro, which is a 3-4 minute walk down the road, we travelled through this to get everywhere. even though taxi was readily available right outside anytime. taxi's are always driving past so no issues should you need one. the hotel was a fair walk away from the souks which is where we wanted to be, so used metro to get there. there wasnt really much else near the hotel as to see. there is a restaurant downstairs in the hotel and as part of ibis there is a bistro. next door there was a turkish restaurant which we tried. it was a 5 star restaurant, very well decorated and money spent on dining accessories, but the food wasnt 5 star more 3 star, so wouldnt recoemmend spending £60 on. i would definately recommend this hotel to family and friends. it states its a four star but i do think it should be a 5 star. i would love it even more if the hotel had a spa. i would be coming back again. well done team! all the best.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel but not as expected. The room which we offered stinked and AC wasn't working. We requested room change & was done, which is good. Must have been better if the room got inspected before getting allocated to customers.

Reviews.Title: “Usual hotel”
Reviews.Author: MairaU
Reviews.Content: We were stayed in this hotel for couple of nights during our trip in United Arab Emirates. Hotel was ok, but there were some weaknesses. There was no sun in swimming pool area till ~14:00. There was no Internet free of charge in the room. Te interior was more like cold, not homelike. There were problems with hairdryer. But breakfast was good, free parking, good location (close to airport).

Reviews.Title: “Good quality / value in dubai”
Reviews.Author: MGinUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night recently for a cost of just over £100 per night. Hotel is fairly new and generic Novotel style which is perfectly adequate. Service is good, room clean and comfortable no complaints really. Internet is free and didn't use the pool. Off the lobby there is a small bar which is fine and opposite the restaurant area which is fine if a little bland but good enough and we used it for a breakfast meeting (nice buffet). I would have no hesitation returning to this hotel when I want a location close to the airport (i,e, for a flying visit) but if spending longer in Dubai i would probably opt for somewhere a little bit nicer and therefore further from the airport. Depends what you need (the other place I've used a lot is the Bustan Al-Rotana but they seem to have raised the prices).

Reviews.Title: “Good locatin for shopping”
Reviews.Author: mahmoodix
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Novotel for 3 nights (15-19 Dec 2011). The location of hotel is very good; 5min walk to the Metro and Deira City Center and 10-15 min to Dubai Mall by taxi (cost 15-20 Dhs). The room was quite but there is a mosque nearby which in every time of praying you hear sound of it and it is noisy and annoying. Stuffs at room were acceptable, sleeping stuffs, bed and sheets were comfortable and well cleaned. There was lack of something in room that you have to request it such as slippers. Internet in the rooms is a cable connection which if you have an iPad you cannot connect. The breakfast buffet was perfect with many choices. The staffs were helpful. The food at "TALA" restaurant was delicious with good price. If you are planning to stay for shopping and relaxation at Dubai, Novotel would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms Bad Servucr”
Reviews.Author: arshadwm
Reviews.Content: Spacious Rooms and Bathrooms. Good Open Air Terrace especially for cigarette Smokers. Courteous Staff Bad Service. They always forget your request. Ideal Location. Matresses are very hard need replacement.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good position handy to metro Shuttle to beach Internet in lobby strong Staff helpful and assisted in our requirements Good value but did not include breakfast pool fine but used by Ibisnest door looking for economy maybe Ibis better value ?

Reviews.Title: “Deteriorated in 12 months”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel 12 months ago we thought it was a sure thing to stay again for our recent trip to Dubai. Unfortunately the hotel has deteriorated somewhat during this time. The lobby area was spotless, however the room was grotty and seemed to need a good clean.. The shower was moldy & the skirtingboards covered in dust & hair! The toilet also ran all night & kept us awake. The staff seemed very distrusting, for example we were asked several times by the pool staff what room we were from, especially when we wanted to take the pool towel back to our room as our son was shivering. Upon check out even though I said we did not use the mini bar, we had to wait for at least 5 min while housekeeping checked, before we were allowed to leave with our pre booked limo service. The hotel did allow for an early check in which was greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent city hotel”
Reviews.Author: grahamdlloyd
Reviews.Content: Very good value and well placed for the shopping mall. Taxis are very cheap and plentiful and are always on hand outside the hotel. Reception staff were most welcoming and the hotel fulfilled all our needs. We ate in both of the restaurants and they were both good value and more than adaquate for what was required. No alchohol allowed in the outside restaurant but that was not a huge problem and other factors compensated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: smp321
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for 4 nights as a stopover on our way home from Australia. We arrived very early in the morning (5am) due to the way Emirates flights are scheduled. Staff were very helpful and allowed us to check-in early (into a different room as ours was still occupied) for the modest sum of 300dhs. Our first room (203) wasn't brilliant as it overlooked a solid brick wall and a nearby mosque which had its first call to prayer at 6am. We weren't quite ready or enthusiastic for this after a 14hr flight. After a couple of hours in the first room staff quickly moved us into our designated room (830). This was a city view and well worth the extra. Being high up and at the end of a corridor, the room was quiet and the view across to Burj Khalifa excellent. We had initial apprehensions about the hotel's location. This was unfounded though as its a 5min walk to the Metro and Deira City Centre Mall is across the road. A note of caution about the Metro though. It goes to most of the places you would want to visit, but not actually right up to them. You still have a bit of travelling by foot, taxi or bus once you get to your stop. Its also closed on a Friday morning. Not helpful if you have something planned. Having said that, taxis's are very cheap and plentiful although their driving can be terrifying. Back to the hotel though, breakfast is excellent with a good choice (no pork products though which is understandable). Wi-Fi is free in the lobby and bar area but not available in the rooms. Internet in the rooms is a cable connection which if I recall correctly was 25dhs an hour which is quite expensive for internet. Downsides are the beds. They're only a double size (I was expecting a king) and they're very hard. Aldo our shower tended to flood the bathroom floor and the tap water didn't go very cold. These are only minor things though.

Reviews.Title: “poor cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Even having prepaid the room, the last available room was given to us with really dirty and disgusting spots on the carpet. A reduction in price would have been at least appropriate. aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: Peter2159
Reviews.Content: Mice cost feel to this budget hotel, decent breakfast area and ideal for mall shopping and metro system

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Rachie11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is value for money. Nice rooms - good size (pay a bit more & get a city view - you can see to the Burj) Good facilities including a nice outdoor pool. The breakfast buffett is good. Mall is right across the road. 3 minute walk to the train station - 15 minute train ride to Dubai Mall & Burj Khalifa (Worlds biggest mall & worlds tallest building). Take the train from either airport terminal 1 or 3 to the Deira City Centre station (will cost around $3NZD where a taxi is $60DHR + (Watch out for people offering you a taxi which aren't regestered - will try to charge you $120 DHR and up)

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Bath Room is required to be looked into in so far as the design. You do not require one more private enclouser inside an enclouser(barh room it self is a private enclouser).You may advise youe Architects/Designers in youe future ventures,

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Deira Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent location, not too far from the airport and handy for the local shopping mall which suited me just fine. The rooms were very clean & well appointed. The check in was also smooth and the duty receptionist Ghalib was very helpful and courteous. Would certainly stay there again on my next visit to Dubai. In addition, if booked in advance, the internet rates quoted represent excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and well designed, but needs to be better managed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot with our children. One chooses Accor to be sure of having a standard service around the world. That was not the case for this hotel. This hotel is well located and well designed, but it needs to be better managed - our rooms were not ready before 1700; one member of staff at reception was so aggressive that we had to ask to swap to his (very pleasant) manager; and one of our two rooms had been poorly cleaned (we are not very difficult but we even found children toys from other people, which are relatively easy to spot...). Worse, the insulation of the room is not good enough so we heard relatively loud music from our room every night of our stay, including once until early morning hours. Food was good and staff at the restaurants were very friendly. Overall, this hotel was not up to Accor standards I am afraid!

Reviews.Title: “good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydneyalicat
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 6 nights on our way to Europe. We were not after a beach holiday so it was a good choice for us. Close to the airport, Deira city center mall over the road and the metro stop on the corner.Got a good pre paid rate and were very happy with this hotel. The included breakfast had a great range of choices and was very good. There are 2 computers in the lobby and the concierge was helpful in booking a couple of trips for us. Used the pool a couple of times and the only complaint is it closes at 8pm and it was also rather warm, so not too refreshing. Would reconmend to anyone not after a beach hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place With Good Location”
Reviews.Author: na_jaMumbai Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is opposite deira city mall and 2 minute walk to the metro station with good connectivity Their room service needs to improve a lot you need to remind them for everything Rooms are nice and offer a sofa bed for kids Nice view of the creek from our room

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: Aravind T
Reviews.Content: This hotel overcharged my bill and I pointed it out during check out and i was promised that it would be refunded right away but after weeks and over 10 phone calls to front desk/reservation/accounts/manager still not getting my money back. Beware of this hotel!! They use every opportunity to cheat and overcharge you. Watch your bill very carefully on check out and make sure you do not leave the hotel till everything is finalized then and there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Shaun L
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights last week. Close to the airport so taxi not too expensive. Close to Metro station and having a mall across the road was very handy. Metro trains very cheap - less than GBP 3.00 for all day ticket travelling anywhere on the network. Breakfast very good with lots of choice and plenty of it. We made good use of the free beach bus which departed on time when we took it. Free Wifi in the lobby. Would recommend this hotel for its location, cleanliness, free beach bus and friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “magic”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: had a great time staff were great food was great all about the hotel very impressed easiy to get to an from airport shopping mall right across the road (wife was happy) dubai is an interesting place,very clean,tour guides for day tour an sarari tour were magic ,,had no hassles wot so ever ,would return in the future

Reviews.Title: “Everytime”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Novatel in Deira city every couple of months and have always enjoyed my time at this hotel. The staff are both very friendly and very professional. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing some time in dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Busines Traveller Comments”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Despite advertise as having WIFI, only the hotel lobby provide this facility and yet the coverage was spotty and limited. Although the hotel was close to the airport, it was far from everything else, which caused long taxi trips. Do not use the hotel to arrange pick up at the airport, a service that other hotels may readily arrange, this hotel charged 100 Dirham where a taxi would cost around 10.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for family week end or business trip”
Reviews.Author: EtienneC2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine even for business trip or family visit in Dubai. Rooms are ok and comfortable. Restaurant is fine, and you have also access to another restaurant located between novotel and Ibis, with good french cuisine. Bar is ok, or even perfect if you come from Saudi !! For the location, access to the metro is very easy, and of course to Deira city center for your shopping. Nothing else to say.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and swimming pool !”
Reviews.Author: cyblexy01
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and swimming pool ! very good restaurant and outstanding breakfast. Rooms are very clean and tidy. Staff is very friendly and very good location. Great price and service. Accor group quality. Good internet and fantastic swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “cleaning and services”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: you must increase the number of housekeeping that to be able to clean very good and fast. the internet has to be for free or full package for the residential time (not by hours) the staff are very nice and helpfull. I can recommend it only for my self not for others and I will be visiting your hotel at the end of November because the Location of the hotel is near City center mall. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Rumpole1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short taxi ride fron the airport opposite a large shopping centre,our room was clean a spacious as well as comfortable. What we liked was its location the shopping centre opposite is the location for the start of the :hop on hop off" bus,We spend the whole day using the bus and still did not see all that was available--this suprised us as we thought a quick trip "around the block" would suffice: We chose to eat at the Deira shops where the variety advailable was great. Would we stay there again "Yes" would we recommend it to others "Yes"

Reviews.Title: “stop over Dubai”
Reviews.Author: catjas0802
Reviews.Content: Hi we stayed here on our stop over on our way to Paris . It was great hotel great atmophere . Very competant staff . As it was rumerdum Turkish 'Aribic celebrate at this time of year at this time no resteraunts were opened. we were starving you could rely on a very good bite to eat to after a long flight from aus. We found very nice food and reasonable prices . Lunch + dinner .We visited the gold soukes ' palm island ' +city tour of dubai very good bus service hop on hop off x 2 days good value . Chris + Pete melbourne .

Reviews.Title: “my trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: room: it very good and well designed location: very eccellent becoase it near of city center mol and metro service: very good and hotel crew smiley Breakfast : it not several avery day same the food no change , cleanlinees: eccellent

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: DGH-UK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a couple of times over the past year and can highly recommend. Excellent location, a short taxi ride from the airport and most attractions. Good facilities and excellent value for money Its not a 5 star hotel but it dosn't claim to be, overall highly recommend. Much much better than a chain hotel anywhere else I have stayed

Reviews.Title: “nice modern clean rooms, but issues to work on”
Reviews.Author: DoctorPJ
Reviews.Content: the hotel is close to the airport. , around 30aed fro m airport, around 10aed to airport. opposite is the large shopping mall, with the metro station about 5 minutes walk away. the room was nice, large, modern , insulated, good airconditioning clean. bathroom and toilet were good size. good water pressure and bathroom amenities provided. bed was large, but the mattress was terribly hard, and not comfortable. i had an issue with cistern running which i reported to hotel, but wasnt acted upon . i had issues with the breakfast which ive addressed with the manager in print. i found it lacking variety- nothing changed, small number of hot dishes, . pancakes each morning were not warm in there minioven, and a staple like scrambled egg, was far to soft and runny. another staple- baked beans- far too salty. and several of the cut fruits were too soft. yes it breakfast provided western and mideast offerings, but little for asian people. a cappucino coffee was extra- most hotels can provide a coffee machine with this option included. the staff were friendly when you could get service. i waited 6 minutes at checkin at night before someone came out to serve me. also at other times, there was 1 staff, handling enquiries, people in queue, answering phones etc. rostering and reception numbers may need review. the pool and gym were good. with the ibis next door, both provide a shuttle bus to the beach each day.

Reviews.Title: “Very good propoerty this side of Dubai Creek”
Reviews.Author: Carl_Icahn
Reviews.Content: Very nice room with a nice view of creek. Room was cleanly and welcoming. Breakfast was decent. Right opposite Deira City Centre and walking distance from the metro station. So overall, the property suits very well for all the tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: MelKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Check-in was fast. Room was pretty comfortable. However, a pity since the view wasn't nice. The location is far from the sky scrapers of Dubai so no view to shout about. There is a huge shopping mall right across though. I really liked the bathroom. The bed was that of a queen bed. We wanted 2 twins but they didn't have twins. However, the room has a sofa bed, Thus, I slept on the sofa bed while my friend took the queen bed. Comfortable enough. Breakfast was good with the usual mix of Middle Eastern and Western fare.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: WessBeirut
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, Ideally located in Deira area, facing Deira City Center mall, very close to the subway station. Clean, room comfortable, and nicely decorated, very clean, ideal for quick business trips in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Positive Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked in tot he moment I checked out, I thought that this was an excellent hotel. The staff were friendly, the hotel was spotless and the room was well appointed and maintained. The location is very convenient too - right opposite the massive Deira City Centre, one of the city's many massive shopping centres. Only a 10 minute drive to the airport too. Strongly recommended

Reviews.Title: “CLAUSTROPHOBIC TOILET NOT FOR THE LARGE”
Reviews.Author: speaktruly
Reviews.Content: During my extentise travels I have never before come across such a small space , about the same size as a shower recess , dedicated to a toilet. What makes it worse is that it faces the shower from which it is divided by an opaque glass panel and then closed off by a similar glass door. I felt totally cramped in this small space even though I am of average size but if you are somewhat on the large size or especially obese you may have some difficulty. Otherwise the hotel is excellent opposite a large shopping mall and our room was spacious and the rest of the bathroom nice with the exception of the tiles in the shower recess very slippery. The Reception foyer was large, impressive and staff very friendly and helpful with our enquiries etc.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay at Novotel Deira City Centre”
Reviews.Author: TerenceHK Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just opposite to Deira City Centre Mall. Just only 5 minutes walk to the Maill and Deira City Centre Metro station. The room is very clean, modern and quiet. Free Wifi at the lobby. When we called a taxi, they always introduced non-meter taxis just parked at the front door of the hotel. However, when we expressed we preferred to meter taxi, they were very willing to call a taxi for us.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here with children”
Reviews.Author: CLARE B
Reviews.Content: I am writting this from the hotel lobby, having flown in from NZ this morning, we were meant to be checking in at 5.45am but the flight was delayed and didnt arrive untill 6.40am, we had booked early check in as we have the children with us and knew they would be very tired, it is now 9.10am and still no room, my boys are at there wits end, we are all over tired and just want to sleep................. and to be honest looking around the lobby we dont look like the only ones waiting for rooms, This is very very poor service when traveling with children, can not recomend. very sad as we were really looking forward to our Dubai stopover, and we really needed a good rest after leaving the Christchurch earthquakes behind, we are here another 2 days but to be honest this has allready put a dampener on things.

Reviews.Title: “FUNCTIONAL STOPOVER LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: jimmykranke
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a 24hr transit. Conveniently placed for Deira Shopping Mall. I asked for a quiet No-Smoking room during the booking process. I'm pleased to report my request was met in full. I would like to see a few smiles from the guys working at check in, the ladies seem to manage it ok? Overall, a good mid budget hotel. A clean modern room, with all the required facilities. I would use it again. Well placed for the airport and Terminal 3.

Reviews.Title: “My stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to stay at due to the good location with a mall right in front of it and close to the airport. Good food and room service. Rooms good as well, quite,clean and secure due to you having to use your key to select the floor in the lift . And the fact that you can have 2 adults and 2 children to each room was nice. There being 2 computers with internet access in the lobby is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay despite hot summer. Sometimes the room service staff were uncourteous. But overall the service was good and we really enjoyed the stay. If i happen to visit Dubai next time i would prefer Novotel Diera City Center. Its proximity to the City center and to the Dubai Metro is added advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Relaible Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Superb location with shopping (City Center) Food (Food Court) and Metro Station all across the road. Only complaint: they charge AED100 per day for internet. Com'on - this is basic service now - make it free!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money business hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulinkabul
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable this hotel offers one of the best value for money deals in Dubai. It is across the road from the City Center Mall one of the less tourist type shopping malls, and 100m from the Metro, which is seriously good value for money. Taxis are easy to find although watch for the hotel taxi routine, they will cost you 50% more than a standard cab regardless of the assurances of the touts. The restaurants leave a bit to be desired, but there are dozens of others in Dubai. Internet is expensive, but that is common. For a short business stay it is definitely on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: halima1981
Reviews.Content: Locatioan was perfect,me my family stayed for 8days all enjoyed our selfs,kids loved the swimming pool.breakfast was nice its a buffet style.hav deria city center jus outside made eating out and shopping easy.also a shop called day2day outside the metro station is open 24hrs can get gifts 4 cheap.taxi was cheap.n change ur money there u get good rate then in uk .if u want designer bags and others go to gold souk u wil find sum but fake.good stuff.wil go again

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Plenty of help, hospitable, and courteous. Excellent stay, easy access to anything in the area. Definitely will recommend to anyone for a place to stay for business or vacation. Unfortunately I don't like the idea of having to write a review, just the recommendation should be good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very much value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: EllesP
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is fantastic. The rooms are spacious, the beds are a bit hard and I don't like the fact that they do not have seperate beds, only queen. The breakfast is really the highlight of this hotel. They have everything. The pool is also very nicely build with comfi chairs. The location is OK. Next time we would stay more towards the Walk because that area is more walkable and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with good value for money. Near the airport and near to a big shoppingcenter "Deira City Center" and metro station. Far from beaches if that is what ypu are looking for. Check out the shop "Day to Day" nearby for a bargin.

Reviews.Title: “The best - indeed”
Reviews.Author: MILeq
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week. In short words: it is the best Novotel I have ever stayed for last 6 years! If you are not planning to spend hundreds of $$$/€€€ then it is the perfect choice for you! Tips: - avoid smoking rooms, unless you smoke - shopping? Just cross the street - turn left from the hotel, go 100m to the red light crossing, cross the street and go through the parking & you are in the shopping mall, which is significantly cheaper than the hotel - swimming pool is not so huge, but going there between 9 & 10 gives you a lot of free loungers - if you are travelling towards Burj Khalifa and further - then metro is cheaper for you (and usually faster). Turn right from the hotel and 3 minutes walk gets you to the nearest metro station. - taxis: there is plenty & these are CHEAP. Especially if you travel in 3-4 persons, then it is real bargain! - food? get a taxi (10 aed) and go to Al Rigga st - there is plenty to choose for local food. If consierge will offer you restaurants just next building - avoid these: rather expensive & so-so food. - Fun Tours in the shopping mall on the other side of the street - avoid them, as the tours are really crappy + they frauded us by double-charging the cc - still trying to get the money back - internet is free in the lobby - just ask for login & pass at the reception

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: vallabhprabhu
Reviews.Content: We had been to Duubai in a hot summer month. Main aim being visiting deira city centre, decided to stay very close to city cent. The mall was just across the hotel as you cross main road. Hotel is conveniently located and very close to most of the attractions. Rooms are well appointed and defiantly a Four star property. Best part was very responsive AC, but be careful to read check in and check out time, as there is no consideration for anyone even if you are with young kids! Staff strictly follow rule book here.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for stopover”
Reviews.Author: ellyndunc
Reviews.Content: We have just had 2 nights here as a stopover on way back from the far east. The rooms were acceptable would not say a 4 star, maybe 3 at best. Our room bed was like sleeping on a brick causing us both back ache. The tea / coffee facilities had used sugar sachets and no spoons just a cocktail stick to make our hot drinks. We asked the maid and did get these replaced with no fuss. Hotel convenient for the shopping centre. Close to airport. Mini Bar in room absolutely extortionate, we bought drinks from Carrefour instead. There was a tear in bed sheet and shower / loo needed a good clean, grouting on tiles grubby. Generally okay for brief stop. Breakfast very good. Reception took 200 AED from my card....I assume to cover anything I billed while staying. I did not order anything or use anything...my 200 AED not refunded on checkout and refused. I hope this gets put back on soon....can management let me know if this will be done. thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Stay @ Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The facilities in the room were below expectations for the difference of price paid between Ibis and Novotel, as i have paid the double for only little more facilities. However the bed and pillows were uncomfortable and had a lack in options which made sleep very difficult!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The first room they gave me was very dirty, the carpet was full of brown stains, the bed's duvet cover was in terrible state the bathroom floor also full of stains and the smell of the room was nasty. So I went back to the front desk and ask for a refund so I could be on my way and go to a decent hotel, the manager came out, apologized for the inconvenient and ask me not to leave the he could show me another room, this time one in decent conditions, I was tired so I went to take a look at this new room but it was like if they would've take me to the exact room they gave me the first time. I end up leaving to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with class and style”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. I stayed at the hotel only 1 month before and the staff at the from desk were helpful and went out of their way to assist me to my room as soon as possible. The location was very central to my needs and was easy to take the metro or walk to the shopping centre. The manager should be very proud to have such wonderful and helpful staffs. I think this hotel wil be a regular stop for me everytime it in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for first time visitor”
Reviews.Author: handsonsavvy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a fifteen minute drive from the airport and it is attached to the City Centre Mall. So for the first time visitor it provides the convenience of a good shopping experience without venturing outside the hotel. The Mall is quite big with many shops and has the Carrefour Hyper market at the basement. The hotel is not swanky like the newer hotels and resorts. It's quite old but in reasonably good condition. Very convenient when you are travelling with a group or with your family. The food selection is adequate. All in all a reasonably priced hotel most suited for first time visitors

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay if you have the money”
Reviews.Author: littleapple123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good and of course it is more expensive than the Ibis hotel next door. You are paying for the room. I won't say it is good value for money. Did not have to pay for the accomodation though for I was on a business trip. The only complaint that I had was the shower was not always hot. There were times that I had to wait for a very long time for the water to get heated up. There were also times that the water just failed to get heated up

Reviews.Title: “GOOD, VALUE FOR MONEY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sanjaylucknow
Reviews.Content: Good great hotel, checked in at around 9PM and the check-in was smooth and fast, the room was tidy and better than our expctations, the location is near to the airport and also across the road was Diera City centre. The swimming pool was great and so was the complimentary breakfast. we feasted on the goodies. Overall we could not find any fault and it was a great stay, will definately visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, the least responsible staff, hotel and operations”
Reviews.Author: mgalumyan
Reviews.Content: 7 days before the trip I tried to book a room for me and my colleagues. The next day got an email saying "your credit card transaction was not authorized ". I asked my colleague to make a reservation using her credit card and it successfully worked. Replied the hotel that I got my reservation done by my colleague and everything is ok. The next day I got a letter saying that the first transaction wasn't authorized and I replied that I got another reservation for the same quantity of rooms for the same period. The next day I got a similar message and replied in a same manner. The next day one more similar message but this time I wrote to leave me alone and to forget the previous reservation. The next day got again a similar email and again answered and said not to bother me anymore with this issue. After 3 days, during check in I found out that they charged me for the room and haven't received any message from me. I was supposed to forward all the messages to them to proof it. It took me an hour to negotiate with them. The guy on phone (from reservation department) said "it's our mistake and we deeply apologize for the situation" and said that will immediately Void the transaction. Then I told him that I need my money back since I was planning to do some shopping. He said, "your money would be back latest tomorrow evening". 5 days passed I tried to settle my account for breakfast and I found out that the re is no money on my card. Called the guy from a reservation department and asked what a hell... where is my money, he asked for some time to consult with accounting department. Few hour later I called him back as he didn't call and he said that they could do nothing and my money will be back next week. To cut this in short, They charged me 780$ for nothing, promised to refund in two days, didn't do it even in a week and left me without money in a foreign country. While knowing that I don't have any other money and this all happened because of their mistake. Strongly do not recommend to stay at this hotel, the reservation department treats Accor customers like a trash!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no issues at all with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelers08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights. This hotel was in a great location and right across the road was the Deira City Shopping Centre. Room was nice, you would get free bottles of water every day delivered to you when they freshened up our room. We were on the 7th floor and faced the shopping centre side and in the distance was the Dubai skyscrapers. Bed was a bit hard though. Bathroom was nice. The buffet breakfast was very nice and we were never bored of it. Every morning there was something a little different in the hot breakfast area. And there was a very nice chef who would cook us an omlette. Taxi's are abundant in Dubai, within seconds one would be pulled up at the front of the hotel. Will definately be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “rooms & Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I hope to be the largest size of rooms. and that is available Iron and preparing their own. The rest of the services they are excellent

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of tuime. good service levels, great location, an exhanustive buffet breakfast. Overall good experience with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, close to airport”
Reviews.Author: fay_fay4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very average. The staff were freindly, I didn't encounter a major problem, but wasn't majorly impressed either. I was in Dubai for work and the hotel was conveniently by the airport. Short walk from the Metra station, which is only two stops away from the airport. It is right infront of City Center Mall. The bathroom was old, and the rubber sealant at the shower and bathtub were stained. But the bathroom was clean and was cleaned daily. Unfortunately the hotel doesn't have wifi in the rooms. It has it only in the loby. Breakfast and dinner were good. The hotel is average. I would recommend it if you would need to be near the airport and don't have a lot of time, or don't want to "tour" Dubai. I've been to Dubai before and just wanted a quiet night in, wasn't interested to go out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharon59Wilts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the this hotel on 30th/31st Dec and were very pleased with it. All areas were spotlessly clean, the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the pool is gorgeous and they provide you with towels and the breakfast was excellent - everything you could ask for. Although there is a large shopping mall across the road, the Emirates Mall and the Dubai Mall, along with the Burj Khalifa are a little distance away. They are easy to get to using the metro but it takes a little while so leave plenty of time. But for value for money this hotel is perfect and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “easy access”
Reviews.Author: TehranMoj
Reviews.Content: good location: near a big shopping centre with many restaurants. almost near metro station & airport. helpfull staff. separate shower case. light room. negative points: no access to free internet in rooms. problem in toilet faucet.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with cramped washroom”
Reviews.Author: prabin71 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very good location with well connectivity. HOtel and service were also good. But rooms were quiet small and the washrooms were even smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Suite Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay overall was quite good. However the toilet fittings were not that great. Another thing was that breakfast was like staying in a 2 star hotel. Even Ibis's breakfast was better then what we had. Still I would like to stay at Novotel or Ibis because of their location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sharkyfs
Reviews.Content: Again a very clean and well presented Dubai hotel. Loacted opposite a very good Mall that has all you could want. The Metro is just round the corner but the staff will not offer the information they direct you totheir own cars or the taxis. Taxis are cheaper than the hotel cars but more than the trips to the various sights. I suspect you can check online the routes but we got one back from the Burj Khalifa and it worked out cheaper than the taxi trips we took to get there. There is a bus from the station to the Burj that you will have to pay extra for, a whole £1.50 each return!!! We didnot have evening meals at the hotel but ate during the day, better option as I suspect that you will need to book and then rush to get back, spoiling the sightseeing. We had a late beakfast the first morning and although it did not finish untill 10:30 the food was cold and people were queing to get in. Not enough tables. We3 went down at 07:30 for the second day and it was empty. You may want to get your drinks at the airport on the way out and buy your soft drinks at the supermarkets. They are costly. Book all your sightseeing on the internet before you go, We appreciate it was Xmas but we were unable to book any of the main sights whilst out there, even the dive in the Malls, aquarium. Rooms very clean and tidy. We were on the top floor and it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “evaluation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 6 am and they offered us a room which later we stayed there during our stay. We had to pay for that room for few hours which we had arrived. Breakfast was good but one of the rooms had not been cleaned well. I was not happy with the reception which were there at our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very good service, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor of this hotel it continuously offers excellent value for money. Great rooms, restaurants and bar in a modern and functional style. Fitness and swimming pool allow to relax after business in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: liz72London
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. The reception staff are highly inefficient, one of them was exceptionally rude to us on arrival (after an overnight flight). Room service is slow or at the worst does not turn up; the breakfast is poor; the swimming pool does not really get the sun; housekeeping do not respond to requests; and we had to remind the chambermaids to bring up two towels instead of one (so very basic things). There are MUCH better hotels than this. Something is going wrong with the management of this hotel. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - enjoyed our Dubai stopover”
Reviews.Author: angaka
Reviews.Content: We decided to do a 3 day stopover in Dubai on our way back to Sydney from Athens. TRavelling with 3 children under 8yrs old, we were a bit apprehensive. Our flight arrrived late at night so we had pre-booked a transfer with the hotel which cost us about 100drh. As we found out later a taxi would have been much cheaper, but seeing there were 5 of us with luggage we thought that one transfer would be easier. Our check in went smoothly, considering our very late check in (about 11:30pm). We ordered some dinner from room service as we were all quite hungry - this took over an hour to arrive which was very disappointing given our kids were very tired and hungry, and didn't get to sleep until past 1am. Despite this, our stay was very comfortable. Breakfast was more than enough variety to start the day. The proximity to Deira City Mall was fantastic - you could catch the hop-on-hop-off buses from here also, although Dubai Mall was one of the furthest stops. I would catch a taxi and go there direct - much quicker and cheaper! Thouroughly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice price-location useful”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel located within easy 2 min walk of Deira City Center. Nice staff. Very good price of USD $102, but......internet pricing was possibily the worst of my last 5 years travel. In room charge was Dhs 75 (USD$20) for 12 hours. Breakfast not included. I liked the buffet but was not thrileld with USD $20 price. Staff at buffet were efficent and helpful. Beware of taxi at hotel that were charging above the norm- They were not the traditional marked taxi, but the had meter....set to who knows what rate. Room quite comfortable. Bed was too hard for my taste. TV channel selection was good. I liked the lobby . Comfortable. Overall, with exception of internet, good place. B

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport but not too close”
Reviews.Author: RBKiwis
Reviews.Content: We had three nights at this hotel and were given room #830 which is roomy with a bath, shower and toilet and has views over the Deira shopping centre directly across the road and of Dubai beyond. As we had a late flight in we decided that this hotel would be a good choice as it is only a ten minute taxi drive from the airport and yet close to the Metro to enable us to check out the rest that Dubai had to offer. We were able to go through the shopping centre across the road from the hotel to get to the Metro station thus avoiding the heat. The hotel staff are helpful and friendly with check in and out quick and easy. The breakfast is a buffet with all the usual fare. We went on a Sundowner Dune Dinner Safari run by a company owned by Emirates Airline which we booked and paid for through Alexander at the hotel concierge (a very helpful fellow). This was a great afternoon / evening and we would highly recommend it. The taxi fare to / from the airport was 25DHS.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to Check Out”
Reviews.Author: engineerfazal
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff does not know their responsibilities,Check-in a shambles, didn't ask us if we need smoking or non-smoking then we have to change room as a result,We were not treated friendly at all,Woman at the front desk rude and unapologetic,check in took ages!staff ignore you,We then had to wait half an hour for our bags to be brought up to our rooms, which eventually turned up after several requests and a visit back down to the front desk.The staff at reception is rude, have no common courtesy,the fridge was dented and dirty on the outside ,Waste lots of time waiting for elevators,The only good thing about this hotel is the location .

Reviews.Title: “2 great stays at Novotel Deira City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Bobkitten74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in February 2010 for 8 nights and liked it so much that we stayed here again for two nights on the way back home from Jakarta to Copenhagen in July. In february we got a great offer with breakfast and paid just around 100 dollars pr.night. In July it was even cheaper but with no breakfast. We had breakfast at Starbucks at Deira City Centre instead. The hotel has a great location, close to the airport and just next to Deira City Centre with lots of great shopping, restaurants and the metro. We tried roomservice arriving very late in the evening. Great food and great service and not expensive at all. They also have a very nice pool area with nice pool lounge chairs. The room was a typical novotel room, nicely decorated and with a nice bathroom. The breakfast was great and the service at the breakfast room amazing. The waiters were working so hard but were still very friendly. The only small disappointment was with the concierge when we were there in February. We wanted to see a camel race, but could not find any information about it on the internet. We asked the concierge and he asked us if we had a telephone number to the place ! We told him that we knew nothing about where and when it took place, but we had hoped that he could help us. Unfortunately he could not. The same with other questions we had, they did not seem very well informed. We asked the receptionist at 9 o'clock what time the shops and banks at Deira City Centre opens, she said they had already open, but we found out they opened at 10. If the staff would get a bit better informed, things would be even more perfect. A special thanks to the kind doorman helping our 7 members big family in the early morning on thursday 15th of July. Getting 3 taxis for us and helping with the luggage. He was all alone and working so hard to help all of us. The hotel deserves an extra star because of him.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel - great for a short stopover in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Ox-Sydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good. The breakfast buffet was extensive and good. The rooms were functional, clean, modern. We had 2 kids. A cot was provided and the sofa folded down. No problem. The pool was good and the gym looked well equipped. Staff were friendly and efficient. Value was good. Location was a few minutes walk to the City Center Mall. This mall is good but not fancy – depends what you’re looking for, Dubai Mall is of course better. There are a couple of restaurants (other than the mall and the hotel) within easy walking distance – an Mid East one on a terrace (looked nice) and an Italian one. The latter was quite good as a family restaurant. We didn’t try the Mid East. You had to pay for Wi-Fi. Recommended for a one-day stay as it’s close to the airport. If you want to explore the city a bit and you’re staying for a couple of days or more you may wish to consider a more central hotel such as the Jumeira Rotana.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ravi46
Reviews.Content: Great location right opposite City Centre Mall, Very comfortable rooms, good and personal service. The two drawbacks are that the whole lobby smells of cigarette smoke and the heavy charges for internet access. A good business hotel and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel quality and pricing in Dubai-Good News”
Reviews.Author: brookway
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, from the airport, to the mall opposite, to the exhibition centre. (metro stop not far). The room is big, the bed comfortable and the bathroom good. The breakfast was very busy, so not a relaxing way to sstart the day. The restaurant was not very good and walkable restaurants nearby were not plentiful, however if you know DXB, you know where to go anyhow. Overall good value after the years of having to pay premium prices at 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: sipivu
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights: - Location is very convenient if you rent a car. The Avis agency is 200-300 meters away from the hotel. A large shopping center is just accross the street and was very convenient for late dinner at the food court open until midnight or 1am. The hotel is about 10-15 minutes away from the airport, depending on the traffic. - The room is spacious, and the bed comfortable. The bathroom product could be a little richer, but is sufficient. - The reception staff was friendly and helpful. However, I felt the concierges were not sufficiently helpful to provide driving directions. Driving can be complicated in Dubai and we were given insufficient directions several times. - Breakfast was good. - The room price was very good (around 68 euros per day + taxes). However, we were charged 50% additional for the first day because we arrived at 6 am. It was the first time such cost was charged to me. Since I have a the highest tier for the AClub card, I think tyis should have been waived. - Internet access is not free from the room. Access with 2 iMac is available for free in the ground . - An Ibis hotel is sharing the building

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointing for the price”
Reviews.Author: nswallace
Reviews.Content: We were on our way from Houston to Jakarta with a stop over in Dubai, why not stay 2 nights to see Dubai. We were glad that we made that decision. Took me a while to choose where to stay as we had never been in Dubai, decided on Novotel, because we stayed in other Novotels in other countries before and never was disappointed. Also found out that although my husband didn't need a visa to stay, I did. The Emirate Airline representative told me an agency to get a hold of, as visas are not issued by the UAE Embassy, but after reading the Embassy's website, I decided to call Novotel in Dubai to find an information. It was very easy, but you have to have 10 days prior to your arrival to get your visa. Your hotel could be the 'host' who would get the visa for you. The fee for the visa plus around USDLR 1350 would be charged to your credit card, plus other information. When you leave Dubai, you can copy the Exit stamp from the immigration on your passport, fax it or email it to the hotel, and they would refund your credit card again. Because we were there for a short time, we took 2 City tours, which we took from across the street from the hotel. The front desk at the hotel was very helpful to give you the information. We took the city tour along the Dubai creek. And then we took the beach tour - to include a tour on a dhow (wooden boat) at sunset. The location of this hotel is only 10 minutes from the airport - taxis are easy. I booked the hotel on line, no problem at all. Although they have free internet, we couldn't use it in the bedroom. You have to use a couple of computers they have at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great For A Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: JG007
Reviews.Content: After last months 'ash cloud' fiasco, my wife, young daughter and myself found ourselves at this hotel (courtesy of Sir Richard Branson) after completing a 7 day cruise (which was another story entirely, avoid Costa Cruises!) around the United Arab Emirates. Situated 5 minutes from the airport it was next to a huge shopping complex yet at the same time felt 'isolated'. The main tourist attractions are a good twenty minutes away by taxi, ie the Burj Khalifa (worlds tallest building), Bhurj Al Arab, Atlantis Palm Hotel etc and there where no restaurants to 'discover' near the hotel. There was plenty in the shopping complex and featured a few westwern favourites including TGI Friday, KFC and of course McDonalds! Eating in a shopping complex is not my idea of holiday cuisine (albeit unplanned holiday cuisine), not even a glass of wine or two helped as alcohol is prohibited in Dubai, except in hotels and after a couple of nights eating here I was ready to see what the hotel had to offer.... Firstly the rooms. Modern, reasonably spacious, flat screen TV's, mini bar and for the businessman a desk to perch the laptop on. The advice most travellers give out is don't use the minibar, instead purchase your drinks (for probably half the price) at a local store and consume them in your room at your leisure. As stated earlier though alcohol is prohibited in Dubai so should you fancy a drink in your room then the minibar or room service is your only viable option and its not cheap..... The hotel has a swimmming pool on the second floor, not a bad size but due to the layout the sunbed space was at a premium. This led to a lot of pre-dawn 'reserving' of beds which was a shame because for a city hotel the pool area was excellent. in fact the lunchtime menu contained some of the best food I had in the entire duration of the holiday and the staff who served it were excellent. Nevertheless being stranded in Dubai didn't seem quite so stressful as you slipped into this great pool to escape the intense heat of the midday sun. After deciding to try the hotel food after a couple of days eating in the shopping complex I was disappointed we hadn't done it from day on. There where two main restaurants, one served an international buffet, the other a French style bistro. We tried both and they didn't disappoint. Had a wonderful steak in the bistro, they made a big fuss of my daughter and the meal was accompanied by a lovely bottle of Australian red, great food and great atmoshere, wished we had never gone to the shopping complex. The last two nights we had the international buffet which was very impressive, some wonderful starters, great mains and tempting puddings made this truly food to remember and had we been paying for this then it would have been certainly money well spent. To sum up, despite the difficult circumstances that led us to spend 6 nights here I would heartliy recommend this hotel to anyone that is in Dubai for a few days or stopping over before continuing their journey, its clean, modern, comfortable and enjoyable....

Reviews.Title: “Not A Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rc33
Reviews.Content: Arrived early from a flight that landed early in the morning however the check-in staff accommodated straight us straight away. The room was ok, all rooms have a double bed and a sofa bed. Wish they had twin bedded rooms as the sofa bed was ok but nothing fantastic. The bathroom was nice with a separate shower and bath. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The location of the hotel is not the closest to the city centre however it is conveniently located across the road from the metro. There is also Deira Shopping Centre located there as well and a good place for get a meal or stock up on any goods. This takes you to most locations wanted. There is free internet available just off the lobby. I had buffet breakfast included in the room rate and reasonable selection of hot and cold foods. It is a reasonable hotel and good for shorter visits.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with Comfortable Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Ms30
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel. We arrived at 5am and waited briefly in the lobby. We decided to pay $80 Canadian in order to check-in earlier. For those who decided to wait in the lobby for the normal afternoon check-in time, they were offered coffee, tea and pastries. I thought that was very considerate and a nice touch by the hotel. A few notes: 1. The hotel is in a good location. It is right across from a big shopping mall. It even has a grocery store so we got water and some food there. Also, it is close to the metro /subway. 2. The breakfast was great. It included different types of pastries, bread, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruits, made-to-order eggs, grilled vegetables, beef bacon, pancakes, cheeses and cold cuts. Drinks included tea, coffee, orange juice, bottled water and milk 3. The room and the bathroom was a good size. Flat screen tv and new furnitures made our stay very comfortable. The only thing is that there is a night club playing loud music into the night. However, we were not really bothered by that. 4. The staff was pleasant and helpful Overall, we recommend this hotel and really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and quite hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Ncholas-CYP
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, and quite hotel located very near to the city center shopping mall. Another big advantage of its location is the metro station which is a couple of minutes walk away from the hotel. My room was spacious with very comfortable bed and big bathroom. The hotel has two restaurants, one serving buffet and the other one al a carte. I tried both and I liked them very much especially the traditional French Bistro one. Although limited selection of food but really tasty! What I didn’t like was the gym. It is located in a very small tiny room with only a couple of fitness equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Good stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: BucketandSpade88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in March 2010. We stayed for two nights on the way to the Far East and one night on the way back. The hotel is ideally situated being only 10 minutes or less in a taxi from the airport, or one stop on the new metro system. The rooms are clean and tidy, usual Novotel standard. The reception staff at 2am in the morning were a bit dippy but most are at that time of the morning. The hotel has pleasant pool on the first floor. We did not eat in the hotel but there is a large shopping mall over the raod where we found a number of good options for breakfast and dinner, also in the shopping mall is a big Carrefour. The metro station is only 3/4 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “No frills- Right price- but can be better!”
Reviews.Author: YMGMumbai
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is bang opposite Deira City Centre, one of the biggest malls of Dubai, so thats a wonderful thing. Quite close to the Metro as well. The rooms are reallyy SMALL and with no frills. No safe, nothing. The staff at the concierge are from Oh No- to Oh Yes!, depends which one you get. Maybe some of them are new and inexperienced. Take some time understanding requests But overall it works out fine. For the price they were offering at the DSF, it was a steal. But beyond the peak season, this will NOT be the place i would like to stay, not unless this is the last option i neeed to take. to sum it up- Very Small rooms with no frills, decent price, good location, but can be better!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: shahmatist
Reviews.Content: First trip to Dubai, and satisfied with my stay in the hotel. In a big sprawling city, choosing the right location is important. This was convenient to shopping, Metro, airport, and the reason for our stay--tennis tournament taking place at Aviation club. It is not convenient to the beach, major attractions (Burj Khalifa or even bigger malls than Deira City Centre). We did endeavor to walk around Deira area to the clock tower and beyond, but for most people taxis are the way to go. While the hotel does not try to outdo others, I liked the Novotel decor, the bed was comfortable (firm mattress was actually my preference) and the bathroom was nice (I did like the separate bath and shower). Our windows were facing the mosque but we could hardly hear it after awhile. Free internet was also nice, but the kiosks were always busy in the evenings. What I did not like so much is cheap-feeling towels in bathroom, and I did not feel most of the concierges were very helpful. But overall, it's a solid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an overnight transfer”
Reviews.Author: ineedaholidayasap
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on on recommendation from a friend, and it was perfect. I was on a transfer from Kolkata to Manchester and needed an overnight hotel. I took a taxi from the airport and it only cost about 35AED and took about 10mins. The check in was quick and efficient. The room was a good size and pristine. Although I had a view of the shopping mall, there was no road noise and had a great nights sleep. I had the afternoon and evening here and could recommend going to the mall opposite, especially during the shopping festival which coincided with my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and very polite staff, recomment to anyone”
Reviews.Author: kndutt
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel after our 14hour trip at 6am. our check in time was around midday but the staff were so helpful that we were provided with complementary breakfast. they sorted the room at had us in our room by 8:30am. You feel you are at home with their service. K&N DUTT

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller021985
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Novotel Deira City centre. The hotel has a much higher standard than any Novotel's i have stayed in within the UK. As soon as we arrived from the airport the staff came an opened the taxi door took our cases in for us, they were brilliant. We arrived at 7am so check in wasn't until 1400 so they took all the details and promised to get our room ready asap, which they did and we had it by 1100. The room we had was on the 9th floor with a great view over the pool area. The room was very spacious with a desk area sofa and good sized double bed. The bathroom was lovely really modern and again plenty of room. We had breakfast included in our rate and it was a good selection. I was really impressed as i had read some reviews there wan't much choice but they had cooked breakfast buffet along with pasteries, fruits, continental breakfast, cereals and a selection of tea/coffee and jucies. The hotel is in a good location for the city sights. Across the road from the hotel is City Centre Mall which is great, plenty of shops, restaurants and a huge supermarket. Also there is a bus station where the tourist bus starts its journey, which is worth getting on if you want to see all the main attractions of the city and also the beach. We also took a walk to creekside park which is really lovely, there is a cable car ride which you can see all over the city in, but when we went the cable car was broken! We took the tourist bus to The Atlantis on the Palm and spent a day at the waterpark there, this was an excellent water park. On the way back from there we stopped off at the Emirates mall and then Dubai mall both worth a look at. We also booked a trip on a desert safari which was fantasic, not for the faint hearted as the drive over the sand dunes is a little hair raising, but once you arrive at the camp in the desert it is a brilliant night. Really enjoyed my stay in Dubai and at the Novotel, would recomend the hotel to anyone looking for a base to explor the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip - very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Enliven
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel ver the New Year period from end of Dec 2009 to beginning of Jan 2010 and cannot really fault this hotel at all - apart from the hairdryer which had a mind of its own and worked when it wanted - but this is very minor. The hotel is very clean - the saff are attentive at breakfast which can get very busy if you went late. The bathroom facilities were good - very relaxing pool area - youcan have food & drinks brought out to you there if you wish. Great location right opposite the Deira City Centre shopping mall - very handyand very easy to get taxis from aswell. We had a fantastic stay here and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “FAB, great value, location, rooms , food and services”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelCumbria
Reviews.Content: Great location, the hotel has a quite relaxed feel to it. The food and breakfasts cant be falted all made fresh and plenty of choice. the staff are so helpful and have a lot of knoledge of the area. The pool is lovly and get sun on it in the afternoon, and you can also ask to have food and drinks in the courtyard area or poolside, its very quite so its nice to relax after busy mornings. the room keeping is up to a very high standsrd

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, affordable, satisfying, great location.”
Reviews.Author: RippinKitten
Reviews.Content: Check in was relatively quick, room was spotless and very comfortable (bed sheets were clean and comfortable), staff were very polite, and the location was the best. I like Deira city centre very much and the parking entrance is literally across the street. I didnt check for facilities available like internet, fitness centre or pool, i wasn't concerned with it, so i can't really say. The rooms were great except for the fact that there were no toothbrushes or soaps supplied, and the toilet.. it was quite cramped. If you lean forward enough, your head would hit the wall facing it. Shower was spotless and i loved it. Over all i was very happy with this hotel, although i must say that i've stayed in cheaper hotels with nicer. more spacey bathrooms (that supply soaps and things), with beds that are just as comfortable. If you're looking for a place in Deira, across the street from Deira city centre, and very satisfying rooms, this is a great place. Just pack a toothbrush.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel, a good chain of hotels”
Reviews.Author: Zidane9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in good location, exactly opp the city centre mall. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean.I was there with a large group. The staff was nice, polite, very helpful all the time during my stay there. Though we were a large group, they handled us with patience. The breakfast though i must say was not up to the mark, There needs to be more options for vegetarians apart from Beans and Potatoes everyday. The confernce facilities is not of large capacity, OVer all good hotel, good location, great rooms, The group was really happy to stay there. I shall go there again with a smaller group or if i went alone.
